basics.name: Ko Matias Adrian Kosasih
basics.summary: Adrian is a Senior Engineer at DNV Japan specialized in offshore wind-related numerical simulations with over eight years of experience in floating and fixed offshore wind turbines. He also has extensive experience in industry research of offshore wind turbines in Japan, including establishing floating offshore wind design workflows using various tools and validating the design results using wave tank experiments and real-world data of a demonstration wind turbine.

work.name: DNV AS
work.summary: Responsible for numerical analysis with Sesam and Bladed suite. Also responsible for the support, presales, and training delivery of offshore wind turbine design using Sesam.

work.name: Hitachi Zosen Corporation
work.summary: Conducted research and development of offshore wind turbines and other offshore structures. Led several R&D projects to develop a new type of offshore structure. Specialized in the coupled analysis of floating offshore wind turbines and other numerical analyses.

work.name: Association for Innovative Technology on Fishing Ports and Grounds (AITEF)
work.summary: Secondment contract (派遣社員) while working in Hitachi Zosen Corporation for a NDA project.

work.name: JFE Engineering Corporation
work.summary: International internship program for selected university students from South East Asia in the JFE Engineering Corporation in Japan.

work.name: Boston Consulting Group (BCG)
work.summary: Summer management consulting internship program in BCG Jakarta. I was part of an operational optimization project for one of Indonesia's biggest consumer goods manufacturers.

awards.title: Silver Medalist - International Olympiad on Astronomy and Astrophysics (IOAA)
awards.summary: IOAA is an annual event in which high school students from around the world compete against each other, solving theoretical, analytical, and observational problems in the fields of astronomy and astrophysics.

awards.title: Bronze Medalist - International Astronomy Olympiad (IAO)
awards.summary: IAO is an internationally recognized annual astronomy scientific-educating event for high school students, which includes an intellectual competition between these students.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
